349: About Us: International Business & Technical Consultants, Inc. (IBTCI), a U.S. based international development consulting company established in 1987, has worked in over one hundred countries and implemented over three hundred projects. IBTCI serves government agencies, private sector companies and several donor agencies. Assignment Title: Graphic Design Consultant Department/Location: IBTCI Home Office, Vienna, Virginia/Remote Technical Point of Contact: Communications Team or designee Type: Consultant Classification: Consultancy Category: Home Office Clearance Required: N/A Overview: IBTCI is currently seeking a talented Graphic Design Consultant to support IBTCI home office on its contracts, business development and marketing activities. The ideal candidate should have experience in creating high-quality graphics for USAID proposals, a strong design portfolio, excellent communication skills, and a keen eye for detail. This is an on demand consultancy over a six month period of performance with a level of effort ceiling of 30 days. Responsibilities: Scope of Work: Using their graphic design, communications, and data visualization skills the consultant will provide support on specific contracts, business development and marketing activities. Tasks could include, but not be limited to: Collaborate with proposal teams to develop graphics and visual representations of complex information and data. Design visually appealing, engaging, and informative graphics, including infographics, charts, tables, diagrams, and maps that meet USAID branding and design guidelines Use Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and other relevant software to create and edit graphics. Work with the proposal team to ensure that graphics are delivered on time and meet proposal requirements. Ensure compliance with graphics and branding standards as specified by the donor, solicitation, and/or IBTCI; Ensure cohesion between diagrams and charts in the same document and between sections written by different authors; Create PowerPoints or other visual presentation tools as needed; Other duties as assigned. Qualifications: Minimum Requirements: Oral and written fluency in English required, fluency in another language preferred. Expert level skills using graphic design software such as Adobe InDesign, Tableau, Canva, or others; Excellent skills in the Microsoft Office software suite, specifically Word, Excel, and Powerpoint; Bachelor's degree in graphic design or a related field. 5+ years of experience in graphic design, preferably in the context of USAID proposals. Strong portfolio showcasing a range of design skills and experience with a variety of software. Strong knowledge of USAID branding and design guidelines. Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams. Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and meet tight deadlines. Strong attention to detail and ability to ensure accuracy in all design work. This position does not authorize/require the consultant to directly communicate with IBTCI clients. This position does not authorize/require the consultant to have decision making authority on final work product.
